page.title: 04Crime in western Paisley
page.content: To find out about the incidence of crime in the Paisley area, we interviewed a community policeman. The most common crime in this area was {dishonesty}.The figures were { {16,576}in 1984.{Housebreaking}came second at{4,007}occurrences in the same year. New crimes in the area include{cheque-card frauds}and { {glue-sniffing}.There are not many serious crimes like {murder}in the area, although they are not unheard of. The age groups which cause the most trouble are {13-19}age group with the worst offenders being {16}and{17 {year olds. Crime is often linked to high unemployment but the police blame lack of parental guidance and poor school discipline. The police are taking a more active part in the community as they visit youth clubs and schools.
